slides.title: Welcome to CIMA F1
slides.content:
# F1 - Financial Reporting

F1 covers **financial statements** and **IFRS**.

## What You Will Learn

- **Framework** - IFRS conceptual
- **Standards** - Key IFRS
- **Financial Statements** - Preparation
- **Groups** - Consolidation

## Syllabus Areas

| Area | Weight |
|------|--------|
| Framework | 15% |
| Key standards | 40% |
| Single entity | 20% |
| Groups | 25% |

slides.title: Conceptual Framework
slides.content:
# IFRS Foundation

## Objective

Provide useful financial information to users.

## Qualitative Characteristics

| Primary | Enhancing |
|---------|----------|
| Relevance | Comparability |
| Faithful representation | Verifiability |
| | Timeliness |
| | Understandability |

## Elements

| Element | Definition |
|---------|------------|
| Asset | Future benefit |
| Liability | Present obligation |
| Equity | Residual interest |

slides.title: IAS 1 Presentation
slides.content:
# Financial Statements

## Complete Set

| Statement | Purpose |
|-----------|--------|
| SFP | Financial position |
| SPLOCI | Performance |
| SOCE | Equity changes |
| SCF | Cash flows |
| Notes | Disclosures |

## Current vs Non-Current

| Current | Non-Current |
|---------|-------------|
| < 12 months | > 12 months |
| Operating cycle | Long-term |

slides.title: Framework Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: How many qualitative characteristics are primary?

slides.title: IAS 16 PPE
slides.content:
# Property, Plant and Equipment

## Recognition

| Cost Element | Include |
|--------------|--------|
| Purchase price | Yes |
| Directly attributable | Yes |
| Dismantling | Yes |
| Admin overhead | No |

## Measurement

| Model | Basis |
|-------|-------|
| Cost | Depreciated cost |
| Revaluation | Fair value |

## Depreciation

```
(Cost - Residual) / Useful Life
```

slides.title: IAS 2 Inventories
slides.content:
# Inventory Valuation

## Rule

```
Lower of Cost and NRV

NRV = Selling Price - Costs to Complete
```

## Cost Formulas

| Method | Use |
|--------|-----|
| FIFO | General |
| Weighted Average | General |
| Specific | One-off items |

## Not Allowed

LIFO is prohibited under IFRS.

slides.title: IAS 38 Intangibles
slides.content:
# Intangible Assets

## Recognition Criteria

| Criterion | Requirement |
|-----------|-------------|
| Identifiable | Separable or contractual |
| Control | Power over benefits |
| Future benefits | Expected |

## Internally Generated

| Phase | Treatment |
|-------|----------|
| Research | Expense |
| Development | Capitalize if criteria |

## Development Criteria

- Technical feasibility
- Intention to complete
- Ability to use/sell
- Probable benefits
- Resources available
- Reliable measurement

slides.title: IFRS 16 Leases
slides.content:
# Lease Accounting

## Lessee Accounting

```
Recognize:
- Right-of-use asset
- Lease liability

At present value of payments
```

## Subsequent Measurement

| Item | Treatment |
|------|----------|
| ROU asset | Depreciate |
| Lease liability | Effective interest |

## Exemptions

- Short-term (< 12 months)
- Low-value assets

slides.title: IAS 37 Provisions
slides.content:
# Provisions and Contingencies

## Recognition Criteria

| Condition | Requirement |
|-----------|-------------|
| Present obligation | Past event |
| Probable outflow | More likely |
| Reliable estimate | Measurable |

## Contingent Liability

| Status | Treatment |
|--------|----------|
| Possible | Disclose |
| Remote | Ignore |

## Contingent Asset

- Probable: Disclose
- Virtually certain: Recognize

slides.title: IFRS 15 Revenue
slides.content:
# Revenue Recognition

## Five-Step Model

```
1. Identify contract
2. Identify performance obligations
3. Determine transaction price
4. Allocate to obligations
5. Recognize when satisfied
```

## Satisfaction

| Type | When |
|------|------|
| Point in time | Control transfers |
| Over time | Continuous transfer |

slides.title: Group Accounting Basics
slides.content:
# Consolidation

## Relationship Types

| Relationship | Treatment |
|--------------|----------|
| Subsidiary | Consolidate |
| Associate | Equity method |
| Joint venture | Equity method |

## Control Definition (IFRS 10)

- Power over investee
- Variable returns exposure
- Ability to use power

## NCI

```
Non-controlling interest:
- Fair value method
- Proportionate share
```

slides.title: Goodwill and Fair Values
slides.content:
# Business Combination

## Goodwill Calculation

```
Consideration
+ NCI at acquisition
- Fair value of net assets
= Goodwill
```

## Fair Value Adjustments

| Adjust | To |
|--------|----|
| Assets | Fair value |
| Liabilities | Fair value |
| Intangibles | Recognize |

## Impairment

Goodwill tested annually.

slides.title: Consolidated Adjustments
slides.content:
# Consolidation Process

## Eliminations

| Item | Adjustment |
|------|------------|
| Investment | Against equity |
| Interco balances | Cancel |
| Interco profits | Remove |
| Dividends | Eliminate |

## PURP

```
Provision for Unrealized Profit

Remove profit on unsold inventory
```

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Congratulations! Summary

You completed **CIMA F1 - Financial Reporting**!

## Key Topics

### Framework
- Conceptual basis
- Qualitative characteristics

### Standards
- IAS 16, 2, 38
- IFRS 16, 15
- IAS 37

### Groups
- Consolidation
- Goodwill
- NCI

## Key Calculations

| Calculation | Formula |
|-------------|--------|
| Goodwill | Consid + NCI - FV Assets |
| NRV | SP - Costs |
| Depreciation | (Cost - RV) / Life |
